gov.usgs.anss.filter

Class MiniSeedFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.filter.MiniSeedFilter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MsHelicorderFilter

    public class MiniSeedFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    The MiniSeedFilter class is used to apply a filter to incoming MiniSeed packets. It will remember the state of the filter based on the channel name and the time of the packet. Packets will be best handled if they arrive in order, otherwise each break results in some data loss as the first data points in a sequence are dropped to remove bad values due to the Gibbs phenomena. This class also serves as a manager of multiple filters based on the channel name so that the caller only needs to specify filter type, and parent edge thread for logging, and then can call it repeatedly for any number of channels.

    • Method Detail

      • filterMiniSeed

        public void filterMiniSeed(MiniSeed msIn,
                           MiniSeedFilter.FilterType filterType,
                           java.lang.String[] filterParams,
                           MiniSeedOutputHandler putbuffCall)
        Parameters:
        msIn - miniSeed to be filtered
        filterType - The type of filter to use.
        filterParams - string list of parameters to be used by filter
        putbuffCall - is a method to be called that will handle the miniseed output from a RawToMiniSeed putbuff call.

      • filterMiniSeed

        protected void filterMiniSeed(MiniSeed msIn)
        This method is a convenience method to call, but should only be used after using the call that includes filterType and params. Failure to do so will result in no operation being performed.
        Parameters:
        msIn - the MiniSeed packet to filter
